Dill Pickle Dip

  • 8 ounces softened cream cheese
  • 1/4 cup dill pickle juice
  • 1/4 cup finely chopped pickle
  • 1/2 cup shredded Colby jack cheese, separated in 1/4 cups
  • 1/2 cup crisped bacon – chopped and separated in 1/4 cups
  • 1/4 cup thinly sliced scallions, plus more for garnish, if desired

Mix cream cheese and pickle juice until combined and smooth. Add chopped pickles, 1/4 cup of shredded cheese, 1/4 cup bacon and scallions. Fold together until fully incorporated. Garnish with remaining cheese, bacon and scallions. Refrigerate until served, with celery, endive, parsnip chips or pork rinds.

File this baby under Keto incognito (I know, I’m very clever,) ’cause your friends and family will never know this is your “diet food!” Salty, crunchy, creamy and of course, bacon-ey. What more does a person need?! That’s 4 of the 5 food groups, right there! And served with crudités, your 5th group of veg is taken care of, too! 5 for 5! Gimme a high 5! Ok, let me stop right there, this could get really out of hand.

 

While any pickle brand is essentially fine and I would never be the one to bash a salty, briny food… I must say, I always prefer a cold pack to a shelf stable jar. My house is never without Claussen Kosher Dills, and they’re definitely a part of this recipe.

I usually take my cream cheese out of the fridge at least one hour in advance, so it has enough time to soften up, making mixing much easier. One way to cheat time, if you’ve forgotten ahead of time is to set your cream cheese on top of your oven while you bake your bacon! (Yes, bake your bacon! No spits, splatters, perfectly crispy and super simple clean up, you’ll thank me later.) The residual heat from the oven will soften that sucker in no time!

While your bacon is becoming a beautiful little butterfly in the oven, take this time to prep out the rest of your ingredients, so once it’s cool enough to chop, you can toss your dip together in less than 5 minutes! And since I know you lined your baking pan in parchment, cleanup is pretty much done, too.

Now, sit back and watch your family gobble this low carb, high fat, waist cinching, bounty of dill-liciousness. Keto on, fam!
